data.name: ConfigCommandDesc
data.value: Gets or sets NuGet config values.

data.name: ConfigCommandExamples
data.value: nuget config -Set HTTP_PROXY=http://127.0.0.1 -Set HTTP_PROXY.USER=domain\user nuget config HTTP_PROXY

data.name: ConfigCommandSetDesc
data.value: One on more key-value pairs to be set in config.

data.name: ConfigCommandAsPathDesc
data.value: Returns the config value as a path. This option is ignored when -Set is specified.

data.name: ConfigCommandSummary
data.value: <-Set name=value | name>

data.name: DeleteCommandDescription
data.value: Deletes a package from the server.

data.name: DeleteCommandNoPromptDescription
data.value: Do not prompt when deleting.

data.name: DeleteCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Package source (URL, UNC/folder path or package source name) to delete from. Defaults to DefaultPushSource if specified in NuGet.Config.

data.name: DeleteCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the Id and version of the package to delete from the server.

data.name: DeleteCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget delete MyPackage 1.0
nuget delete MyPackage 1.0 -NoPrompt

data.name: DeleteCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <package Id> <package version> [API Key] [options]

data.name: HelpCommandAll
data.value: Print detailed help for all available commands.

data.name: HelpCommandDescription
data.value: Displays general help information and help information about other commands.

data.name: HelpCommandMarkdown
data.value: Print detailed all help in markdown format.

data.name: HelpCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Pass a command name to display help information for that command.

data.name: HelpCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget help
nuget help push
nuget ?
nuget push -?

data.name: HelpCommandUsageSummary
data.value: [command]

data.name: InstallCommandDescription
data.value: Installs a package using the specified sources. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in the NuGet configuration file are used. If the configuration file specifies no sources, uses the default NuGet feed.

data.name: InstallCommandExcludeVersionDescription
data.value: If set, the destination folder will contain only the package name, not the version number

data.name: CommandNoCache
data.value: Disable using the machine cache as the first package source.

data.name: CommandNoHttpCache
data.value: Disable using the Http cache and contact all configured package source sources for live information.

data.name: InstallCommandOutputDirDescription
data.value: Specifies the directory in which packages will be installed. If none specified, uses the current directory.

data.name: InstallCommandPrerelease
data.value: Allows prerelease packages to be installed. This flag is not required when restoring packages by installing from packages.config.

data.name: CommandSourceDescription
data.value: A list of packages sources to use for this command.

data.name: InstallCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the id and optionally the version of the package to install. If a path to a packages.config file is used instead of an id, all the packages it contains are installed.

data.name: InstallCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget install elmah
nuget install packages.config
nuget install ninject -o c:\foo

data.name: InstallCommandUsageSummary
data.value: packageId|pathToPackagesConfig [options]

data.name: InstallCommandVersionDescription
data.value: The version of the package to install.

data.name: ListCommandAllVersionsDescription
data.value: List all versions of a package. By default, only the latest package version is displayed.

data.name: ListCommandDescription
data.value: Displays a list of packages from a given source. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config are used. If NuGet.config specifies no sources, uses the default NuGet feed.

data.name: ListCommandPrerelease
data.value: Allow prerelease packages to be shown.

data.name: ListCommandIncludeDelisted
data.value: Allow unlisted packages to be shown.

data.name: ListCommandSourceDescription
data.value: A list of packages sources to search.

data.name: ListCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify optional search terms.

data.name: ListCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget list
nuget list -verbose -allversions

data.name: ListCommandUsageSummary
data.value: [search terms] [options]

data.name: ListCommandVerboseListDescription
data.value: Displays a detailed list of information for each package.

data.name: Log_RestoreNoCacheInformation
data.value: The NoCache option is only for disabling the HTTP cache and not the global packages folder. It is recommended to use the NoHttpCache option instead to disable the use of the HTTP cache.
data.comment: Do not translate NoCache and NoHttpCache

data.name: Option_NonInteractive
data.value: Do not prompt for user input or confirmations.

data.name: Option_Verbosity
data.value: Display this amount of details in the output: normal, quiet, detailed.

data.name: PackageCommandBasePathDescription
data.value: The base path of the files defined in the nuspec file.

data.name: PackageCommandBuildDescription
data.value: Determines if the project should be built before building the package.

data.name: PackageCommandDescription
data.value: Creates a NuGet package based on the specified nuspec or project file.

data.name: PackageCommandExcludeDescription
data.value: Specifies one or more wildcard patterns to exclude when creating a package.

data.name: PackageCommandExcludeEmptyDirectories
data.value: Prevent inclusion of empty directories when building the package.

data.name: PackageCommandNoDefaultExcludes
data.value: Prevent default exclusion of NuGet package files and files and folders starting with a dot e.g. .svn.

data.name: PackageCommandNoRunAnalysis
data.value: Specify if the command should not run package analysis after building the package.

data.name: PackageCommandOutputDirDescription
data.value: Specifies the directory for the created NuGet package file. If not specified, uses the current directory.

data.name: PackageCommandPackagesDirectory
data.value: Specifies the packages folder.

data.name: PackageCommandPropertiesDescription
data.value: Provides the ability to specify a semicolon ";" delimited list of properties when creating a package.

data.name: PackageCommandSolutionDirectory
data.value: Specifies the solution directory.

data.name: PackageCommandSymbolsDescription
data.value: Determines if a package containing sources and symbols should be created. When specified with a nuspec, creates a regular NuGet package file and the corresponding symbols package.

data.name: PackageCommandToolDescription
data.value: Determines if the output files of the project should be in the tool folder.

data.name: PackageCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the location of the nuspec or project file to create a package.

data.name: PackageCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <nuspec | project> [options]

data.name: PackageCommandVerboseDescription
data.value: Shows verbose output for package building.

data.name: PackageCommandVersionDescription
data.value: Overrides the version number from the nuspec file.

data.name: PackCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget pack
nuget pack foo.nuspec
nuget pack foo.csproj
nuget pack foo.csproj -Build -Symbols -Properties Configuration=Release
nuget pack foo.nuspec -Version 2.1.0

data.name: PushCommandDescription
data.value: Pushes a package to the server and publishes it.

data.name: PushCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Package source (URL, UNC/folder path or package source name) to push to. Defaults to DefaultPushSource if specified in NuGet.Config.

data.name: PushCommandSymbolSourceDescription
data.value: Symbol server URL to push to.

data.name: PushCommandTimeoutDescription
data.value: Timeout for pushing to a server in seconds. Defaults to 300 seconds (5 minutes).

data.name: PushCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the path to the package and your API key to push the package to the server.

data.name: PushCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget push foo.nupkg 4003d786-cc37-4004-bfdf-c4f3e8ef9b3a
nuget push foo.nupkg 4003d786-cc37-4004-bfdf-c4f3e8ef9b3a -src http://customsource/
nuget push foo.nupkg
nuget push foo.nupkg.symbols
nuget push foo.nupkg -Timeout 360

data.name: PushCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <package path> [API key] [options]

data.name: SearchCommandDescription
data.value: Searches a given source using the query string provided. If no sources are specified, all sources defined in %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config are used.

data.name: SearchCommandPreRelease
data.value: Include prerelease packages.

data.name: SearchCommandSourceDescription
data.value: The package source to search. You can pass multiple -Source options to search multiple package sources.

data.name: SearchCommandTake
data.value: The number of results to return. The default value is 20.

data.name: SearchCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify search terms.

data.name: SearchCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget search foo
nuget search foo -Verbosity detailed
nuget search foo -PreRelease -Take 5

data.name: SearchCommandUsageSummary
data.value: [search terms] [options]

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandDescription
data.value: Saves an API key for a given server URL. When no URL is provided API key is saved for the NuGet gallery.

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Server URL where the API key is valid.

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the API key to save and an optional URL to the server that provided the API key.

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget setapikey 4003d786-cc37-4004-bfdf-c4f3e8ef9b3a
nuget setapikey 4003d786-cc37-4004-bfdf-c4f3e8ef9b3a -Source http://example.com/nugetfeed

data.name: SetApiKeyCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <API key> [options]

data.name: SourcesCommandDescription
data.value: Provides the ability to manage list of sources located in NuGet.config files.

data.name: SourcesCommandNameDescription
data.value: Name of the source.

data.name: SourcesCommandPasswordDescription
data.value: Password to be used when connecting to an authenticated source.

data.name: SourcesCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Path to the package(s) source.

data.name: SourcesCommandFormatDescription
data.value: Applies to the list action. Accepts two values: Detailed (the default) and Short.

data.name: SourcesCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <List|Add|Remove|Enable|Disable|Update> -Name [name] -Source [source]

data.name: SourcesCommandUserNameDescription
data.value: Username to be used when connecting to an authenticated source.

data.name: SpecCommandAssemblyPathDescription
data.value: Assembly to use for metadata.

data.name: SpecCommandDescription
data.value: Generates a nuspec for a new package. If this command is run in the same folder as a project file (.csproj, .vbproj, .fsproj), it will create a tokenized nuspec file.

data.name: SpecCommandForceDescription
data.value: Overwrite nuspec file if it exists.

data.name: SpecCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget spec
nuget spec MyPackage
nuget spec -a MyAssembly.dll

data.name: SpecCommandUsageSummary
data.value: [package id]

data.name: UpdateCommandDescription
data.value: Update packages to latest available versions. This command also updates NuGet.exe itself.

data.name: UpdateCommandIdDescription
data.value: Package ids to update.

data.name: UpdateCommandPrerelease
data.value: Allows updating to prerelease versions. This flag is not required when updating prerelease packages that are already installed.

data.name: UpdateCommandRepositoryPathDescription
data.value: Path to the local packages folder (location where packages are installed).

data.name: UpdateCommandSafeDescription
data.value: Looks for updates with the highest version available within the same major and minor version as the installed package.

data.name: UpdateCommandSelfDescription
data.value: Update the running NuGet.exe to the newest version available from the server.

data.name: UpdateCommandSourceDescription
data.value: A list of package sources to search for updates.

data.name: UpdateCommandVersionDescription
data.value: Updates the package in -Id to the version indicated. Requires -Id to contain exactly one package id.

data.name: UpdateCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget update
nuget update -Safe
nuget update -Self

data.name: UpdateCommandVerboseDescription
data.value: Show verbose output while updating.

data.name: CommandApiKey
data.value: The API key for the server.

data.name: SymbolApiKey
data.value: The API key for the symbol server.

data.name: DefaultConfigDescription
data.value: NuGet's default configuration is obtained by loading %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config, then loading any nuget.config or .nuget\nuget.config starting from root of drive and ending in current directory.

data.name: InstallCommandRequireConsent
data.value: Checks if package restore consent is granted before installing a package.

data.name: InstallCommandSolutionDirectory
data.value: Solution root for package restore.

data.name: Option_ConfigFile
data.value: The NuGet configuration file. If specified, only the settings from this file will be used. If not specified, the hierarchy of configuration files from the current directory will be used. To learn more about NuGet configuration go to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/configuring-nuget-behavior.

data.name: CommandDisableParallelProcessing
data.value: Disable parallel processing of packages for this command.

data.name: PackageCommandMinClientVersion
data.value: Set the minClientVersion attribute for the created package.

data.name: CommandPackageSaveMode
data.value: Specifies types of files to save after package installation: nuspec, nupkg, nuspec;nupkg.

data.name: PackageCommandIncludeReferencedProjects
data.value: Include referenced projects either as dependencies or as part of the package.

data.name: UpdateCommandFileConflictAction
data.value: Set default action when a file from a package already exists in the target project. Set to Overwrite to always overwrite files. Set to Ignore to skip files. If not specified, it will prompt for each conflicting file.

data.name: SourcesCommandStorePasswordInClearTextDescription
data.value: Enables storing portable package source credentials by disabling password encryption.

data.name: RestoreCommandDescription
data.value: Restores NuGet packages.

data.name: RestoreCommandPackagesDirectory
data.value: Specifies the packages folder.

data.name: RestoreCommandRequireConsent
data.value: Checks if package restore consent is granted before installing a package.

data.name: RestoreCommandSolutionDirectory
data.value: Specifies the solution directory. Not valid when restoring packages for a solution.

data.name: RestoreCommandUsageDescription
data.value: If a solution is specified, this command restores NuGet packages that are installed in the solution and in projects contained in the solution. Otherwise, the command restores packages listed in the specified packages.config file, Microsoft Build project, or project.json file.

data.name: RestoreCommandUsageSummary
data.value: [<solution> | <packages.config file> | <Microsoft Build project>] [options]

data.name: PushCommandDisableBufferingDescription
data.value: Disable buffering when pushing to an HTTP(S) server to decrease memory usage. Note that when this option is enabled, integrated windows authentication might not work.

data.name: PushCommandNoSymbolsDescription
data.value: If a symbols package exists, it will not be pushed to a symbol server.

data.name: CommandFallbackSourceDescription
data.value: A list of package sources to use as fallbacks for this command.

data.name: CommandMSBuildVersion
data.value: Specifies the version of MSBuild to be used with this command. Supported values are 4, 12, 14, 15.1, 15.3, 15.4, 15.5, 15.6, 15.7, 15.8, 15.9, 16.0. By default the MSBuild in your path is picked, otherwise it defaults to the highest installed version of MSBuild.

data.name: AddCommandDescription
data.value: Adds the given package to a hierarchical source. http sources are not supported. For more info, goto https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#add-command.

data.name: AddCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specifies the path to the package to be added and the package source, which is a folder or UNC share, to which the nupkg will be added. Http sources are not supported.

data.name: AddCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget add foo.nupkg -Source c:\bar\
nuget add foo.nupkg -Source \\bar\packages\

data.name: AddCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <packagePath> -Source <folderBasedPackageSource> [options]

data.name: AddCommandSourceDescription
data.value: Specifies the package source, which is a folder or UNC share, to which the nupkg will be added. Http sources are not supported.

data.name: InitCommandDescription
data.value: Adds all the packages from the <srcPackageSourcePath> to the hierarchical <destPackageSourcePath>. http feeds are not supported. For more info, goto https://docs.nuget.org/consume/command-line-reference#init-command.

data.name: InitCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Specify the path to source package source to be copied from and the path to the destination package source to be copied to.

data.name: InitCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget init c:\foo c:\bar
nuget init \\foo\packages \\bar\packages

data.name: InitCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <srcPackageSourcePath> <destPackageSourcePath> [options]

data.name: ExpandDescription
data.value: If provided, a package added to offline feed is also expanded.

data.name: LocalsCommandDescription
data.value: Clears or lists local NuGet resources such as http requests cache, temp cache or machine-wide global packages folder.

data.name: LocalsCommandExamples
data.value:
nuget locals all -clear
nuget locals http-cache -clear
nuget locals temp -list
nuget locals global-packages -list

data.name: LocalsCommandSummary
data.value: <all | http-cache | global-packages | temp | plugins-cache> [-clear | -list]

data.name: LocalsCommandClearDescription
data.value: Clear the selected local resources or cache location(s).

data.name: LocalsCommandListDescription
data.value: List the selected local resources or cache location(s).

data.name: RestoreCommandP2PTimeOut
data.value: Timeout in seconds for resolving project to project references.

data.name: PackageCommandSuffixDescription
data.value: Appends a pre-release suffix to the internally generated version number.

data.name: Option_ForceEnglishOutput
data.value: Forces the application to run using an invariant, English-based culture.

data.name: RestoreCommandUsageExamples
data.value: nuget restore MySolution.sln
data.comment: command line example, do not localize

data.name: CommandDirectDownload
data.value: Download directly without populating any caches with metadata or binaries.

data.name: CommandMSBuildPath
data.value: Specifies the path of MSBuild to be used with this command. This command will takes precedence over MSbuildVersion, nuget will always pick MSbuild from this specified path.

data.name: RestoreCommandRecursive
data.value: Restore all referenced projects for UWP and NETCore projects. This does not include packages.config projects.

data.name: ForceRestoreCommand
data.value: Forces all dependencies to be resolved even if the last restore was successful. This is equivalent to deleting project.assets.json. (Does not apply to packages.config)

data.name: InstallCommandDependencyVersion
data.value: Overrides the default dependency resolution behavior.

data.name: InstallCommandFrameworkDescription
data.value: Target framework used for selecting dependencies. Defaults to 'Any' if not specified.

data.name: PackageCommandInstallPackageToOutputPath
data.value: Specify if the command should prepare the package output directory to support share as feed.

data.name: PackageCommandOutputFileNamesWithoutVersion
data.value: Specify if the command should prepare the package output name without the version.

data.name: PackageCommandConfigFile
data.value: Specify the configuration file for the pack command.

data.name: VerifyCommandDescription
data.value: Verifies a signed NuGet package.

data.name: VerifyCommandCertificateFingerprintDescription
data.value: Verify that the signer certificate matches with one of the specified SHA256 fingerprints. A certificate SHA256 fingerprint is a SHA256 hash of the certificate used to identify the certificate. Multiple inputs should be semicolon separated.

data.name: VerifyCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget verify -Signatures .\..\MyPackage.nupkg -CertificateFingerprint "CE40881FF5F0AD3E58965DA20A9F571EF1651A56933748E1BF1C99E537C4E039;5F874AAF47BCB268A19357364E7FBB09D6BF9E8A93E1229909AC5CAC865802E2" -Verbosity detailed
nuget verify -Signatures C:\packages\MyPackage.nupkg -CertificateFingerprint CE40881FF5F0AD3E58965DA20A9F571EF1651A56933748E1BF1C99E537C4E039
nuget verify -Signatures MyPackage.nupkg -Verbosity quiet
nuget verify -Signatures .\*.nupkg

data.name: VerifyCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <verification_type> <package_path> [options]

data.name: VerifyCommandSignaturesDescription
data.value: Specifies that package signature verification should be performed.

data.name: SignCommandCertificatePasswordDescription
data.value: Password for the certificate, if needed. This option can be used to specify the password for the certificate. If no password is provided, the command will prompt for a password at run time, unless the -NonInteractive option is passed.

data.name: SignCommandCertificatePathDescription
data.value: File path to the certificate to be used while signing the package.

data.name: SignCommandCertificateFingerprintDescription
data.value: SHA-1 fingerprint of the certificate used to search a local certificate store for the certificate. The certificate store can be specified by -CertificateStoreName and -CertificateStoreLocation options.

data.name: SignCommandCertificateSubjectNameDescription
data.value: Subject name of the certificate used to search a local certificate store for the certificate. The search is a case-insensitive string comparison using the supplied value, which will find all certificates with the subject name containing that string, regardless of other subject values. The certificate store can be specified by -CertificateStoreName and -CertificateStoreLocation options.

data.name: SignCommandDescription
data.value: Signs a NuGet package with the specified certificate.

data.name: SignCommandExamples
data.value: nuget sign MyPackage.nupkg -CertificatePath C:\certificate.pfx nuget sign MyPackage.nupkg -CertificatePath \\path\to\certificate.pfx nuget sign MyPackage.nupkg -CertificateFingerprint certificate_fingerprint -OutputDirectory .\signed\

data.name: SignCommandOverwriteDescription
data.value: Switch to indicate if the current signature should be overwritten. By default the command will fail if the package already has a signature.

data.name: SignCommandHashAlgorithmDescription
data.value: Hash algorithm to be used to sign the package. Defaults to SHA256.

data.name: SignCommandOutputDirectoryDescription
data.value: Directory where the signed package should be saved. By default the original package is overwritten by the signed package.

data.name: SignCommandSummary
data.value: Signs a NuGet package.

data.name: SignCommandTimestampHashAlgorithmDescription
data.value: Hash algorithm to be used by the RFC 3161 timestamp server. Defaults to SHA256.

data.name: SignCommandUsageDescription
data.value: Signs a NuGet package.

data.name: SignCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget sign MyPackage.nupkg -Timestamper https://foo.bar
nuget sign .\..\MyPackage.nupkg -Timestamper https://foo.bar -OutputDirectory .\..\Signed

data.name: SignCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <package_path> -Timestamper <timestamp_server_url> [-CertificatePath <certificate_path> | [ -CertificateStoreName <certificate_store_name> -CertificateStoreLocation <certificate_store_location> [-CertificateSubjectName <certificate_subject_name> | -CertificateFingerprint <certificate_fingerprint>]]] [options]

data.name: SignCommandCertificateStoreLocationDescription
data.value: Name of the X.509 certificate store use to search for the certificate. Defaults to "CurrentUser", the X.509 certificate store used by the current user. This option should be used when specifying the certificate via -CertificateSubjectName or -CertificateFingerprint options.

data.name: SignCommandCertificateStoreNameDescription
data.value: Name of the X.509 certificate store to use to search for the certificate. Defaults to "My", the X.509 certificate store for personal certificates. This option should be used when specifying the certificate via -CertificateSubjectName or -CertificateFingerprint options.

data.name: SignCommandTimestamperDescription
data.value: URL to an RFC 3161 timestamping server.

data.name: CommandInvalidArgumentException
data.value: Invalid value provided for '{0}'. For a list of accepted values, please visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: SignCommandMultipleCertificateException
data.value: Multiple options were used to specify a certificate. For a list of accepted ways to provide a certificate, please visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: SignCommandNoArgumentException
data.value: No value provided for '{0}'. For a list of accepted values, please visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: SignCommandNoCertificateException
data.value: No certificate was provided. For a list of accepted ways to provide a certificate, please visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: SignCommandNoPackageException
data.value: No package was provided. For a list of accepted ways to provide a package, please visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: SignCommandMissingArgumentException
data.value: No value provided for '{0}', which is needed when using the '{1}' option. For a list of accepted values, please visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference
data.comment: 0 - primary param name 1 - other param name

data.name: SignCommandNoTimestamperWarning
data.value: The '-Timestamper' option was not provided. The signed package will not be timestamped. To learn more about this option, please visit https://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/command-line-reference

data.name: VerifyCommandAllDescription
data.value: Specifies that all verifications possible should be performed to the package(s).

data.name: SourcesCommandTrustDescription
data.value: Make a source a trusted repository for repository signature verification.

data.name: CommandNoServiceEndpointDescription
data.value: Does not append "api/v2/packages" to the source URL.

data.name: SourcesCommandValidAuthenticationTypesDescription
data.value: Comma-separated list of valid authentication types for this source. By default, all authentication types are valid. Example: basic,negotiate

data.name: PackageCommandSymbolPackageFormat
data.value: When creating a symbols package, allows to choose between the 'snupkg' and 'symbols.nupkg' format.
data.comment: Do not localize snupkg and symbols.nupkg

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandDescription
data.value: Provides the ability to manage the list of trusted signers.

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget trusted-signers
nuget trusted-signers Add -Name existingSource
nuget trusted-signers Add -Name trustedRepo -ServiceIndex https://trustedRepo.test/v3ServiceIndex
nuget trusted-signers Add -Name author1 -CertificateFingerprint CE40881FF5F0AD3E58965DA20A9F571EF1651A56933748E1BF1C99E537C4E039 -FingerprintAlgorithm SHA256
nuget trusted-signers Add -Repository .\..\MyRepositorySignedPackage.nupkg -Name TrustedRepo
nuget trusted-signers Remove -Name TrustedRepo

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <List|Add|Remove|Sync> [options]

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandAllowUntrustedRootDescription
data.value: Set allowUntrustedRoot to true for the trusted signer's certificate to be added.

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandAuthorDescription
data.value: Add the author signature of the package as a trusted author.

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandCertificateFingerprintDescription
data.value: Fingerprint of the certificate to trust.

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandFingerprintAlgorithmDescription
data.value: Hash algorithm used to calculate the certificate fingerprint. Defaults to SHA256.

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandNameDescription
data.value: Name of the trusted signer.

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandOwnersDescription
data.value: List of owners allowed for a package signed with the trusted repository.

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandRepositoryDescription
data.value: Add the repository signature or countersignature of the package as a trusted repository.

data.name: TrustedSignersCommandServiceIndexDescription
data.value: Service index for a repository to be trusted.

data.name: UpdateCommandDependencyVersion
data.value: Overrides the default dependency resolution behavior.

data.name: PushCommandSkipDuplicateDescription
data.value: If a package and version already exists, skip it and continue with the next package in the push, if any.

data.name: RestoreCommandForceEvaluate
data.value: Forces restore to reevaluate all dependencies even if a lock file already exists.

data.name: RestoreCommandLockedMode
data.value: Don't allow updating project lock file.

data.name: RestoreCommandLockFilePath
data.value: Output location where project lock file is written. By default, this is 'PROJECT_ROOT\packages.lock.json'.

data.name: RestoreCommandUseLockFile
data.value: Enables project lock file to be generated and used with restore.

data.name: PackageCommandDeterministic
data.value: Specify if the command should create a deterministic package. Multiple invocations of the pack command will create the exact same package.

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandFilePathDescription
data.value: Path to certificate file.

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandFindByDescription
data.value: Search method to find certificate in certificate store (see docs).

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandFindValueDescription
data.value: Search the certificate store for the supplied value. Used with FindValue (see docs).

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandForceDescription
data.value: Skip certificate validation.

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandPackageSourceDescription
data.value: Package source name.

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandPasswordDescription
data.value: Password for the certificate, if needed.

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandStoreLocationDescription
data.value: Certificate store location (see docs).

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandStoreNameDescription
data.value: Certificate store name (see docs).

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandStorePasswordInClearTextDescription
data.value: Enables storing portable certificate password by disabling password encryption.

data.name: ClientCertificatesDescription
data.value: Provides the ability to manage list of client certificates located in NuGet.config files

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandUsageSummary
data.value: <List|Add|Update|Remove> [options]

data.name: ClientCertificatesCommandUsageExamples
data.value:
nuget client-certs Add -PackageSource Foo -Path .\MyCertificate.pfx
nuget client-certs Add -PackageSource Contoso -Path c:\MyCertificate.pfx -Password 42
nuget client-certs Add -PackageSource Foo -FindValue ca4e7b265780fc87f3cb90b6b89c54bf4341e755
nuget client-certs Add -PackageSource Contoso -StoreLocation LocalMachine -StoreName My -FindBy Thumbprint -FindValue ca4e7b265780fc87f3cb90b6b89c54bf4341e755
nuget client-certs Update -PackageSource Foo -FindValue ca4e7b265780fc87f3cb90b6b89c54bf4341e755
nuget client-certs Remove -PackageSource certificateName
nuget client-certs
nuget client-certs List

data.name: SourcesCommandProtocolVersionDescription
data.value: The NuGet server protocol version to be used. Currently supported versions are 2 and 3. See https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/api/overview for information about the version 3 protocol. Defaults to 2 if not specified.
